clinical_study.brief_title: ALPPS (Liver Partition and Portal Vein Ligation) for Two-stage Hepatectomy for Colorectal Liver Metastasis
clinical_study.official_title: Associating Liver Partition and Portal Vein Ligation (ALPPS) for Potentially Resectable Liver Metastasis From Colorectal Cancer: Prospective Evaluation of the Early Two-stage Hepatectomy by the Simon's Methods

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is evaluate the feasibility of early two-stage hepatectomy in patients with liver metastasis from colorectal cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
In France, each year around 36,000 new cases of colorectal cancers are registered responsible in 16,000 deaths because of liver metastasis.
In case of bilobar metastasis, classic two-stage hepatectomy with portal embolization could be performed.
An alternative to the classic surgery, early two stage hepatectomy, could be proposed to simplify the patient's management and to improve the resectability.

primary_outcome.description: the number of complete surgical procedure is defined as the number of patients in whom the two stage hepatectomy is complete.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: one year after the two stage hepatectomy
secondary_outcome.description: the overall mortality is defined as the number of patients who are dead at one year after the surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: number of patient with hepatocellular insufficiency
secondary_outcome.description: the hepatocellular insufficiency is defined by a prothrombin rate below 50%
the overall morbidity is classified according to the Dindo Clavien classification

secondary_outcome.time_frame: one week prior to the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: the remnant liver volume is evaluated with the Myrian Software and calculated by the radiologist

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the day before the first stage surgery and the day before the second stage surgery
secondary_outcome.description: the quality of life is evaluated thanks to the EORTC QLQ C30 LMC 21 form the day before the first stage surgery and the day before the second stage surgery.

arm_group.description: the two stage hepatectomy is defined as a two step procedure: first step: hepatotomy with ligature of the right branch of the portal vein second step (one week after the first step): right hepatectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- potentially resectable liver metastasis from colorectal cancer
- portal embolisation required
- older than 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- synchronous surgery on the colon or the rectum
- extra hepatic metastasis
- history of hepatectomy
- pregnancy or breastfeeding
